intro: Pyrrocoma longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf pyrrocoma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. Its leaves are elongated and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pyrrocoma longifolia is typically found in coastal dunes and other sandy habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing the soil and supporting local biodiversity.
